intro: Ruizia mauritiana, commonly known as the African flame or flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, serrated leaflets. It thrives in tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Ruizia mauritiana is also valued for its ability to provide shade and its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
